turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Bare-legged owl.
turn.1: What is the scientific name of the Bare-legged owl?
turn.2: Bare-legged owl The bare-legged owl ("Margarobyas lawrencii"), also called the Cuban bare-legged owl or Cuban screech owl, is a species of owl in the family Strigidae that is endemic to Cuba and Isla de la Juventud.
turn.3: what genus does it belong to?
turn.4: It belongs to the monotypic genus Margarobyas.
turn.6: The bare-legged owl was described in 1800 and for a time, it was considered the same species as the Puerto Rican screech owl.
turn.7: who determined it to be its own species?
turn.8: However, it was later determined to be its own species by George Newbold Lawrence in 1868.
turn.9: what other genera has it been placed in?
turn.10: It has variously been placed in the genera ""Noctua"", "Gymnoglaux", and "Gymnasio".
turn.12: The American Ornithological Society moved it to the genus "Otus" in 1998.
